result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquan L Clemmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquan L Clemmer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for school.

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS with the following conditions a to probation:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable case finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees, if applicable, due during the period of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time/part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  Letter from the Defendant.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment, if needed.
*  Obtain GED/HSED/High School Diploma

Court will consider expungement if Defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Marquan L Clemmer in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Marquan L Clemmer in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Morgan Willz supervised by Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing at request of defense counsel. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquan L Clemmer in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held. Defense counsel is seeking a DPA resolution and requests a status conference date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Marquan L Clemmer in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Marquan L Clemmer in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 5.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Marquan L Clemmer not in court.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/20/15 @ 1:30pm
